string-array.name: descriptionLong
string-array.item: Landmark 17th-century Mughal fortress built in towering red sandstone, now a complex of museums.
73m tapering tower built in 1193 by Qutab-ud-din Aibak after defeat of Delhi\'s last Hindu kingdom.
Imposing Arc de Triomphe-style gate commemorating the Indian soldiers killed in the First World War.
17th-century, red sandstone Mughal-style mosque with a 25,000 capacity & 40m high minarets.
Opulent red-sandstone tomb of Mughal Emperor Humayun, built in 1572 & surrounded by formal gardens.
Religious site also known as the Lotus Temple, opened in 1986 and open to those of all religions.
Over 11,000 artisans worked on this lavishly decorated Hindu temple complex inaugurated in 2005.
Official residence plus Mughal and herbal gardens of the President of India, with visits by request.
13 architectural astronomy instruments built in 1724 at the orders of Mughal emperor Muhammad Shah.
This large Hindu temple covers 7.5 acres & features numerous shrines, fountains & a garden.

string-array.name: food_description
string-array.item: Start off with one of the oldest eateries in Delhi. This 100-year-old shop is known for serving giant, hot and juicy Jalebis.
A plate of Dahi Bhalla at Natraj is a ritual for people who visit Chandni Chowk regularly.
If Choley Bhature and lassi is food anaesthesia, then this place will induce food coma!
For years, people have been queueing up in front of Alkauser every evening, hoping their kebabs are not sold out.
Jama Masjid is a paradise for a food lovers, and this iconic place is right at the entrance of this paradise.
The true place for Mughlai food.
You will fall in love at first bite!
The man behind the kadhai can pick up fried pakoras from the hot oil with bare hands. It happens only in Delhi!
You won\’t be able to finish a plate by yourself.
If you\'re not drooling already, this will surely make you drool!

string-array.item: Where: 795, Dariba Kalan Road, Dariba Corner, Opposite to Central Baptist Church, Chandni chowk
Where: 1396, Main Road Near Central Bank, Opposite, Paranthe Wali Gali, Kucha Mahajani, Chandni Chowk
Where: 30, Vasant Place Market, Near Malai Temple, R K Puram, New Delhi
Where: No.8, Jama Masjid Matia Mahal Road, Matia Mahal
Where: Jama Masjid, Gali Kababian, Old Delhi
Where: 29, Defence Colony Market, Defence Colony, New Delhi
Where: 2298, Gurudwara Road Chowk, Karol Bagh, New Delhi
Where: 651/52, Church Mission Road, Fatehpuri, Chandni Chowk

string-array.name: timing
string-array.item: Timings: 12 pm to 4 pm, 7 pm to 11 pm (7 pm to 11 pm on Tuesday)
